text: Hi Lasma! I’m glad to hear that you had a productive January and you were able to do some tutorials. It’s great that you have some free time, really do make the most of it :blush: I can’t believe that we are so far through February already!
Work has been going well. Lots of deadlines as always haha! But I’m moving to a new studio in a week or two and it’s always nice to get to know new people in the VFX community.
That’s very exciting about Outpost :+1::skin-tone-2: My current supervisor was there for his last project, Watchmen.

You ask a good question. In my personal opinion, it does depend on on the deadline. 80% of the time I would say that you should get your showreel in a really good place before sending it in. However, if there is a short deadline, it can be worth just shooting in an application. At least they can see your name.

How happy are you with your showreel?

It’s also good to note that studios will keep a record of you and your work for future roles as well. And you can always send in an updated showreel which they can update in their system :+1::skin-tone-2:
Especially as you start to get credits and obviously your showreel will evolve from student work
When is the deadline for applications to Outpost? I seem to remember that you would rather work in Bournemouth if possible?
